text:
Github Pages in a Nutshell

every github repository can opt to have a repository specific website
GitHub Pages is designed to document and/or market the software developed in the repo the URL pattern is: user.github.io/repository-name
GitHub Pages sites either reside on a separate gh-pages branch or in the docs folder on the main branch.
GitHub Pages can be activated through the Github GUI
GitHub Pages can host either .md files or .html webpages (including .js and .css)

libxml2-dev \

-v local/path:/var/lib/postgresql/data  postgres:11

-d: run as daemon, i.e., terminal window available
-e: pass on an environment parameter, in this case a password
-p: port forwarding: host port:docker port
-v: Mount for persistent storage
(!): To make the two containers talk to each other, consider docker compose.

Documentation of Functions



#' Create Basic Descriptive Statistics
#'
#' Creates means, standard deviations and
#' default quantiles from an numeric input vector. 
#' 
#' @param distr numeric vector 
#' @export 
create_basic_desc <- function(distr){
  out <- list(
    mean = mean(distr),
    sd = sd(distr),
    quantiles = quantile(distr)
  )
  out
}

section: Are There Any Disadvantages of Databases?
text:
Are There Any Disadvantages of Databases?

You have to maintain them, even if you don‚Äôt need them
more setup overhead: dev and production system(s) needed
solid, free solutions are only temporal
you need an interface for collaborators who don‚Äôt speak SQL
some really, really, really big datasets may ask for specific methods

section: Start Simple, Catch a Breath of SQL Air with SQLite
text:
Start Simple, Catch a Breath of SQL Air with SQLite

library(RSQLite)
db_path = "../data/h4sci.sqlite3"
con <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), db_path)
dbWriteTable(con, dbQuoteIdentifier(con,"mtcars"), mtcars, overwrite = T)
dbWriteTable(con, dbQuoteIdentifier(con,"flowers"), iris, overwrite = T)

dbGetQuery(con, "SELECT * FROM flowers LIMIT 3")

  Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa
2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa
3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa


Note: Foreign Key Handling is very limited in SQLite.

                  dbname = "postgres",

                  host = "some.server.or.ip",
                  password = .rs.askForPassword(
                    "enter your pw"
